results.title: Raptures : an underwater odyssey
results.creator_credit: David Hannan Productions, David Hannan and Lucy Trippett
results.brief_description: David Hannan and his team have travelled to new locations to films this sequel to the fantastic “Coral Sea dreaming”. This extroadinary musical documentary is the culmination of 7 years filming in Micronesia, the Indian Ocean, the Coral Sea and the Great Barrier Reef. Stunning new cinematic techniques deliver vision of exceptional quality complemented by a musical score composed by Vance Burrow. This is an intoxicating musical journey capturing the beauty and diversity of our fragile ocean realm which can be used as a tool for stress release and meditation

results.title: Rapids of the Colorado
results.brief_description: Filmed in the Grand Canyon, this non-narrated film follows a raft trip by members of the Sierra Club through the rapids of the Colorado River, recording both the dangers and the beauty of the river.

results.title: Rapid transit
results.brief_description: Forms of rapid transit are vital links in a balanced transportation system. The variety of existing systems in use in the United States and in Toronto, Canada, are shown and the film then goes on to forecast the forms of the new rapid transit facilities soon to become available for use in big cities.

results.title: Raphael: the prince of painters. [Vol. 2]
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, RM Arts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
The second of a two volume series, ‘Raphael: the prince of painters’ provides great background to Raphael’s life, influences, education and professional friendships as an artist beyond his apprentice years. The documentary starts with Raphael’s arrival to Rome aged twenty-five. Already famous for his work in Florence this volume focuses on Raphael’s art as a matured vision and reflects on his relationship with the Vatican and Pope Julius the second and his entry into aristocratic high culture at a time of unrivalled confidence and riches in the Catholic Church. Raphael’s tapestry work at the Sistine Chapel and the ‘Transfiguration’ altarpiece are focussed on in this documentary, his philosophy being reflected by his close friendships in humanist thinkers Baldassare Castiglione and Pietro Bembo and architect Donato Bramante. Written and narrated by David Thompson.

results.title: Raphael: the apprentice years. [Vol. 1]
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, RM Arts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Part one of a two volume series, ‘Raphael: the apprentice years’ provides great background to Raphael’s life, influences, education and professional friendships as a young man up to the age of 25. In this documentary writer and narrator David Thompson (former critic of The Times) reappraises the work of Raphael providing an in-depth look into the development of his career and his relationships with mentors and leading contemporaries like Pierro Della Francesca, Leonardo di Vinci and Michelangelo. His formative years as an artist are covered from his life as a young apprentice in Urbino influenced by the work of Pierro Della Francesca to Peruggia where he was fellow student with Leonardo da Vinci and Florence where he had formed many of his friendships with notable contemporaries as Michelangelo. Shot on location the documentary discusses liberally the influences upon his work with in-depth coverage of his drawings, paintings and sculptural reliefs. What is revealed is Raphael’s passion for nature, light and colour, classicism, the ‘School of Athens’, mathematics and perspective.

results.title: Rapeseed Your Alternative Crop
results.brief_description: As wheat crops decrease in value Rapeseed farming is flourishing. This video examines not only the financial advantages of Rapeseed crops, but also those apparent to the wheat growing industry when crops of wheat are grown in paddocks where Rapeseed was produced the previous year. Not only does a higher yield occur, a 30% increase is evident, but there are less weeds, insects and wheat root diseases, the cycle of the latter having actually been broken by the planting of Rapeseed the previous year.
results.description: As wheat crops decrease in value Rapeseed farming is flourishing. results.title: Rape: the right to resist
results.creator_credit: Elinor Shields, Mercenary Productions and Pat Shields
results.brief_description: Presents the positive options that a woman has available to her under attack or attempted rape conditions. Shows her how to face her assailant and the strategies to be employed in evading and ultimately escaping.

results.title: Rape: a crime of war (D)
results.creator_credit: Silva Basmajian, ONF | NFB and Shelley Saywell
results.brief_description: Throughout history, the rape of innocent women during war time has been a common, but hidden occurrence; it is only now that an international court, The Hague, is trying to convict someone for rape as a war crime. This video follows four women who courageously recount their stories of rape and confinement in Bosnia during the recent conflict. It also conducts interviews with the legal personnel behind The Hague Trial. Archival footage from hearings in Nuremberg, Nanking, Rwanda and Bosnia are interspersed with images of Western art and culture which present a confusing portrayal of rape and attempt to legitimize rape during war time as an inevitable outcome. Previewing is recommended.

results.title: Rape. Part 2. Providing the proof
results.creator_credit: AIMS Instructional Media, Karen Smith, Richard Cullather and Richard Siegel
results.brief_description: Deals with the preservation of corroborating evidence in the investigation of rape. Offers information on procedures, the establishment of fact, the collection and analysis of demonstrative evidence, the chain of possession, identification procedures and protection for the victim.
